timeline.message:
added new channels and extra fixes

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Lafois <benjamin.lafois@gmail.com>

added multiple channels

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Lafois <benjamin.lafois@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Why do you need an enum for this when you can just use the ByteOrder class directly instead?
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: The error logging level should be reserved for issues catastrophic enough to threaten the operation of openHab itself. An error in a binding shouldn't qualify for this. Please read the openHab coding guidelines for expected use of logging in bindings.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText:
If the thread was interrupted you should try and return as soon as possible since an interrupt means that the system wants your thread to shutdown.
Simply returning early from this may not be sufficient as the method's caller might continue operating as if things are normal. I suggest having the InterruptedException continue up the stack and let the caller handler it.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.message:
fixes after PR comments

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Lafois <benjamin.lafois@gmail.com>

added support for AUTO fan mode

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Lafois <benjamin.lafois@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: These should be QuantityTypes now instead.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Fixed. Have also fixed other units (SetPoint, IndoorTemperature, OutdoorTemperature...) all migrated to QuantityType
replies.author: blafois

timeline.bodyText: all locking should be done in a try statement with the unlock inside the finally clause.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.message:
Merge after move from 3.0.0-SNAPSHOT to 3.1.0-SNAPSHOT

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/main' into daikinmadoka-fixes-enhancements

timeline.bodyText: I think that calling this inside of a lock might risk a deadlock in the core. Can you call this outside of your lock/unlock block?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I dont see other option. The goal here is to avoid the Byte Array Output Stream to be modified. Otherwise, I should maybe clone the BOS and call the received response after ?
replies.author: blafois

replies.bodyText: Copying the array then calling receivedResponse later would be preferred, yes.
replies.author: cpmeister
